texts: On Easter Saturday there will be changes to TfL and National Rail services in and around London as major modernisation work takes place. Some services will not be operating, and others will be busier than usual as customers use alternative routes.
All travellers should:
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Plan ahead","Allow more time for their journey","Check before departing","Know their travel options"]}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Tube"}
Bakerloo, Central, Jubilee and Northern lines are expected to be busier than normal.
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Central line"}
Central line trains will not stop at Tottenham Court Road.
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Jubilee line"}

The Jubilee line will be suspended between Waterloo and Wembley Park. Rail replacement bus services will run from Wembley Park to Baker Street (calling at all stations) and from Wembley Park to Stonebridge Park for connections to the Bakerloo line and central London.
The Stratford to Waterloo section of the line may be busier than usual.
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Metropolitan line"}

The Metropolitan line will be suspended between Aldgate and Northwood/Uxbridge. If you are travelling into the centre from north west London, additional Piccadilly line services will run from Uxbridge and Rayners Lane.

Rail replacement bus services will call at all stations between Rayners Lane and Kenton (Bakerloo line). On the Watford, Chesham, and Amersham branches, Metropolitan line services will continue to run as far as Northwood.
Rail replacement bus services will run from Wembley Park to Northwood calling at all Metropolitan line stations and Kenton (Bakerloo line).
A rail replacement bus service will also run from Watford Junction to West Ruislip (Central line) via Watford, Croxley, and Rickmansworth.
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Piccadilly line"}
Covent Garden will be exit only.
Additional services will run from Uxbridge and Rayners Lane.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Trams"}
Trams will not run between Reeves Corner and Sandilands. A rail replacement bus service will operate for tram passengers stopping at Sandilands, East Croydon and near to Reeves Corner/Church St.
Buses will not serve Lebanon Road, Wellesley Rd, George St, Central and West Croydon tram stops.
A walking route between Sandilands and Reeves Corner will be signed. Tickets will be accepted on local bus services.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"London Overground"}
Use London Overground trains between Highbury & Islington and Dalston Kingsland, or local buses when these are unavailable.

Replacement buses operate between Dalston Kingsland and Shadwell. Tickets will be accepted on local London Underground services via all reasonable routes, for entrance and exit at Canada Water and Stratford stations only.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Rail"}
For more detailed information, visit the National Rail Enquiries Easter travel site .
Waterloo, Victoria and Marylebone stations are expected to be busier than normal.
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Chiltern"}

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["No trains between Marylebone and Great Missenden","One bus per hour will run between Great Missenden and Beaconsfield for trains to/from Marylebone","Birmingham to Marylebone services are expected to be very busy"]}

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["All lines will be closed between Hayes and Harlington and Didcot Parkway including Thames Valley branch services.  Valid tickets for Acton Main Line, West Ealing, and Hanwell will be accepted on TfL services","The service between West Ealing and Greenford will be closed.  Valid tickets will be accepted on London Underground and London buses","There will be an hourly train service with all services diverted to Waterloo. Valid First Great Western tickets will be accepted between Reading and Waterloo only. The diverted train services will have a much longer journey than usual - 65 minutes compared to a usual time of approximately 30 minutes - and are expected to be very busy. South West Trains services between Reading and Waterloo will also be busier than normal","Extensive rail replacement bus services will be running"]}

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["There will be no service between Euston and Watford Junction.  Buses will run between Edgware (Northern line) and Hemel Hempstead. Alternatively, London Overground services are also available between Euston and Watford Junction","There will be no service between Watford and St Albans Abbey.  Rail replacement bus services will run between Watford Junction and St Albans Central for rail connections","Special train services will be running. Other services will run on amended timetables"]}

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Engineering work will take place between Charing Cross/Cannon Street and New Cross/Charlton with various line closures","Southeastern services will not be calling at Deptford, Greenwich, London Bridge (platforms 1 to 6), Cannon Street, Charing Cross, Waterloo East, Maze Hill, or Westcombe Park","Some trains will divert to Blackfriars and Victoria. Additional trains will depart from New Cross","A rail replacement bus service will be running between Lewisham and Charlton","If you are travelling via London Bridge, Cannon Street, Charing Cross, Waterloo or Waterloo East please travel to Blackfriars or Victoria and change for London Underground services. You can change at Lewisham for train services to Victoria or travel to New Cross and change for London Overground services to Canada Water and change again for London Underground services","Valid train tickets will be accepted on London Overground services between New Cross and Canada Water, on reasonable routes on London Underground services between Southwark/Embankment and Canada Water and on DLR between Lewisham and Greenwich"]}

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Services between London Bridge and Horsham will be departing from East Croydon","Services will be suspended between London Bridge and West Croydon (via Sydenham)","Services will be suspended between Watford Junction and Clapham Junction","You can use London Overground, London Underground, or rail replacement bus services","Passengers for Horsham should take trains to London Gatwick/East Croydon and change for services to Horsham","Southern passengers between West Croydon and Central London should travel via London Overground services from/to New Cross Gate, Brockley, Honor Oak Park, Forest Hill and Sydenham","For the duration of this work valid rail tickets will be accepted on London buses between Highbury \u0026 Islington and Dalston Junction, replacement buses between Dalston Kingsland (calling at Dalston Junction) and Shadwell, on London Underground entering/exiting at Canada Water and Stratford and on London buses between Sydenham and Crystal Palace"]}

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["No services between Euston and Watford Junction","Trains will terminate at Rugby or Milton Keynes Central","If you are travelling to London from the West Midlands and the North West you should use Chiltern services from Birmingham or Midland Main Line services via Derby or Leicester","Passengers travelling to or from Scotland should use alternative routes between Milton Keynes and Birmingham New Street or use the East Coast Mainline"]}

Drivers and motorcyclists are advised to:

The service will be suspended between Canning Town and Beckton. Rail replacement bus services will run between Canning Town and Beckton every 10 minutes. Local buses such as the E6 are also available.
